name: The Politics of Immigration and Multiculturalism in Canada
description: This course examines Canadian immigration and multiculturalism from theoretical, empirical and applied perspectives. It includes a discussion of normative foundations, an analysis of the components of the policy framework, and an assessment of the impact of immigration and multiculturalism on other aspects of social, cultural and political life.
exclusions: POL490H1 (Topics in Canadian Politics I: Immigration and Multiculturalism in Canada), offered in Winter 2014
